title: Mushrooms à la Grecque
ingredients: The rind of ½ lemon, cut into julienne strips
1½ pounds tightly closed mushrooms, quartered if large
Minced fresh parsley for the garnish
instructions: In a stainless steel or enameled saucepan cook the onion with the lemon rind in the oil over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes, or until they are soft but not brown.  Add carefully one cup of water, the wine, the lemon juice, the parsley stems, the bay leaf, the thyme, the cracked peppercorns, the mustard seeds, and salt, to taste.  Bring the liquids to a boil, and boil the mixture for 5 minutes.  Add the mushrooms, simmer the mixture for 3 minutes, and transfer the mushrooms with a slotted spoon to a serving dish.

Cook the liquid remaining in the pan over moderately high heat until it is reduced by half, add salt and pepper, to taste and pour the liquid over the mushrooms.  Garnish the mushrooms with the parsley leaves.
Source:  Balloons Over Burgundy by Naomi Barry, Gourmet Magazine, August 1983.
